programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: The team struggles to explain how a DAF 33 gearbox works, and office manager Sarah attempts to bring order to the auto memorabilia sale.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: Henry Ford's plan, with the help of Albert Kahn, to build a giant factory in Michigan, covering 3.5million sq ft and including an aircraft production line half a mile in length.

programme.title: The Churchills
programme.desc: Historian David Starkey profiles two of Britain's greatest wartime leaders. He begins by revealing how Winston Churchill came to write a biography of his ancestor John, who led the nation against Louis XIV of France. Starkey also explores how preparations for the Second World War were affected by the prime minister's knowledge of his 17th-century forebear's achievements.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Sam leads the inquiry into a fire at a cinema, and finds that the last unidentified body bears an uncanny resemblance to a man murdered many years previously. Unfortunately, an interview with the gangster charged with the murder - played in a straight role by comedian Jack Dee - leaves her more confused than she was to begin with. Amanda Burton stars.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Adam Okaro returns to Sun Hill, where he resumes his role as Superintendent - and immediately asks Jo Masters to find out how the press obtained a photo of Lesley Palmer. Meanwhile, Smithy and Laura Bryant continue to investigate the real Gabriel Kent's identity - and try to fathom the true nature of his relationship with June Ackland.

programme.title: London's Burning
programme.desc: The team help a tax driver who has got his arm caught in a drain. Meanwhile, Pitbull appoints a reluctant Recall to represent him at his disciplinary hearing.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Gita is devastated by what she has seen; Michelle has good news; Phil has a proposition for Frank; and when Nadia turns up again, Grant decides to take matters into his own hands.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Press Preview
programme.desc: A preview of the stories appearing in tomorrow's national newspapers.

programme.title: Sky News
programme.desc: A summary of the latest news headlines.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Scott & Bailey
programme.desc: Rachel is criticised for a lack of progress with the investigation and she knows she must find both a murder weapon and the encryption code used to access the website. However, as the team makes a significant breakthrough in the case, DSI Julie Dodson makes a discovery which jeopardises Rachel's position as acting DI. Meanwhile, when Janet's attempt to help Taisie results in a complaint, her faith in justice is tested, and both Scott and Bailey have life-changing decisions to make about their futures. Crime drama, starring Lesley Sharp and Suranne Jones.

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Kisstory: Old Skool & Anthems
programme.desc: It's time to go back in time with KISSTORY! The biggest old skool anthems ever from your favourite artists.

programme.title: Up All Night! Kiss Beats
programme.desc: Let the world sleep! But here at Kiss we are still up, still delivering the finest beats for your nocturnal jam.

programme.title: Chart Hits & New Vids
programme.desc: We've got all the hits that are storming the charts right now, along with some brand new releases from your favourite and new artists.

programme.title: All The Hits, All Night
programme.desc: Non-stop hits to see you all the way through the night.

programme.title: Wheeler Dealers
programme.desc: Part two of two. Auto enthusiast Mike Brewer and mechanic Edd China continue to restore the Porsche 944 Turbo, using all their skills to overhaul the sports car.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton recreates a D-Day parachute jump in a genuine Second World War uniform.

programme.title: American Chopper
programme.desc: Paul Jr finally calls his father to offer his condolences for Helen's death, PJD begins a charity build for the March of Dimes and OCC finishes a bike for John Christner Trucking.

programme.title: Aircraft Stories
programme.desc: The masterminds behind the Soviet space programme, whose accomplishments range from the first satellite and the first ICBMs, to Mir, Buran and the ISS.

programme.title: Dirty Jobs
programme.desc: Mike Rowe takes on the tough task of working on board the Star of India, the world's oldest merchant ship, where his tasks include tarring the rigging and greasing the mast.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The team visits the birthplace of the Bugatti Veyron, and examines the car's inner workings.

programme.title: How It's Made: Dream Cars
programme.desc: The crew heads to the birthplace of the Morgan 3-Wheeler in England to examine the classic car's inner workings and exterior.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: Three murder investigations involving poison, including arsenic and potassium chloride - one of which requires toxicology tests on frozen tissue from the victim.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: The case of family man Richard Arenas, who was gunned down in broad daylight. With no apparent motive or witnesses, investigators tried to track down his killer on CCTV.

programme.title: Murder Comes to Town
programme.desc: The case of a respected Kentucky businesswoman, found bludgeoned and stabbed to death in her home. Detectives followed a long path to pursue her killer.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: The abduction of Indiana woman Anita Woolridge from her Indiana home. Detectives suspected a man from her local health club and pressed on to find Anita before it was too late.

programme.title: Animal Cops Houston
programme.desc: Assistant Chief investigator Charles Jantzen tries to save 70 cats and dogs from a run-down private animal rescue centre.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown tries to understand what has happened to a shih tzu cross after it was found to be bleeding internally while being groomed.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Sydney veterinary surgeon Dr Chris Brown tries to save Jonti the cat, which has suffered a gaping neck wound after playing with the family dog.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: Jacqueline goes in search of two dresses of different styles for her wedding, while Christina arrives for her second fitting.
